lines.content: Koya is a personnal assistant chatbot that keeps track of the user's task via Command Line Interface (CLI)
Adds a todo task to the list of task
Adds an event to the list of task
Adds a deadline to the list of task
Format: deadline n/description by n/date or time
Deletes a task from the list
Format: mark n/index of the task
List all task which has the given description
_**Listing all the tasks from the list: list**_
List all the tasks from the list
Koya is a personnal assistant chatbot that keeps track of the user's task via Command Line Interface (CLI)
In order to use the chatbot, carefully follow the steps below:
1. Have Java 17 installed on your laptop
, you can verify the java version by running the following command in your terminal:
4. Open a terminal and cd to where the .jar file is located
6. Type the desired command in the command box (select any commands from the Features section below) and press enter
1. The program is case sensitive. Carefully follow the format for each features!
2. All parameters that must be input by the user are CAPITALIZED.
e.g. deadline /by DESCRIPTION , DESCRIPTION is the parameter. The user may for instance input: deadline /by Monday 3PM
Adds a deadline task to the list

Note: The task's index are automatically adjusted as a task gets deleted. To ensure one is referring to the right task index, perform the list command to view the task's index.

* Contains the parsing methods of Event and Deadline task.
public static final int DEADLINE_CHAR_COUNT = 9; // "deadline " has 6 char including spaces and '/'
public static final int EVENT_CHAR_COUNT = 6; // "event " has 6 char including spaces and '/'
public static final int FROM_CHAR_COUNT = 7; // " /from " has 7 char including spaces and '/'
public Parser(String description, String from, String to) {
String description = input.substring(DEADLINE_CHAR_COUNT, dividerPosition).trim(); // 9: 8 for deadline + 1 for the space
String by = input.substring(dividerPosition + BY_CHAR_COUNT).trim(); // 5 for the number of characters in " /by "}
